text: The Ambassador of Australia for Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation is an officer of the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade and the head of the delegation of the Commonwealth of Australia to the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC), based with its secretariat in Singapore. The position has the rank and status of an Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary and has been sent since March 1996, when Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Trade Tim Fischer appointed Peter Grey as the first Ambassador, although APEC has existed since 1989. ==Ambassadors== {| border="1" class="wikitable" |- style="background-color:#cfc;" ||Name||Image||Start of term||End of term||References |- |Peter Grey||||March 1996||8 April 1998|| |- |Joanna Hewitt||||8 April 1998||25 May 2000|| |- |Pamela Fayle||||25 May 2000||20 December 2002|| |- |Dr Geoff Raby||75px||20 December 2002||19 January 2005|| |- |Doug Chester||||19 January 2005||19 December 2005|| |- |David Spencer||||19 December 2005||13 July 2009|| |- |Ric Wells||75px||13 July 2009||December 2011|| |- |David Spencer||||December 2011||20 September 2013|| |- |Sam Gerovich||75px||20 September 2013||5 August 2015|| |- |Brendan Berne||75px||5 August 2015||22 March 2017|| |- |Simon Newnham||||22 March 2017||present|| |} ==References== ==External links== *APEC Branch, DFAT Category:Ambassadors of Australia for Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation Category:Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation
title: Ambassador of Australia for Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation
